description: [allAfrica] Washington, DC -- "Africa can expect substantial changes from the United States over the next four years," Rama Yade, director of the Atlantic Council's Africa Center, wrote in a pre-Inauguration analysis. While Donald Trump in his first term pursued an "America first" foreign policy, as he has committed to do again, the "new centrality" that Africa enjoys on the world stage will necessitate adaptations to the U.S. approach, Rama predicted.
title: Africa: Trump Will Change U.S.-Africa Ties - How Much and How Fast?

description: [New Times] I'd promised myself that I wouldn't watch Donald Trump's inauguration, but I failed miserably. On Monday, overcome with morbid curiosity and armed with a hot cup of tea, I watched the ceremony as if it were a blockbuster movie.
title: Africa: Trump's Inauguration Speech - Wrong On Some Counts, but Right On Ambition

description: [allAfrica] As we mark the International Day of Education 2025, the convergence of artificial intelligence (AI) and human learning presents an unparalleled opportunity and a profound challenge. This year's theme, "AI and education: Preserving human agency in a world of automation," invites us to critically assess how this transformative technology reshapes education while safeguarding the core values of human development and agency.
title: Africa: Balancing AI and Human Agency in Education

description: [This Day] *To play England, Ireland for prospective berth in semifinals
title: Africa: Nigeria Reach Super 6 Stage After Nervy Loss to S'Africa

description: [This Day] Abuja -- Oando Plc, one of Africa's leading indigenous energy solutions, yesterday announced that it had successfully completed and won the bid for the operatorship of oil block KON 13 in Angola.
title: Africa: Oando Expands Upstream Footprint in Africa, Wins Bid for Angola Oil Block

description: [ISS] President Donald Trump's withdrawal from the OECD minimum 15% global tax deal could hurt Africa.
title: Africa: Trump Attacks Global Minimum Tax

description: [UN News] Marking the International Day of Education, UN Secretary-General António Guterres has emphasized learning as a basic human right and foundation for individual and societal growth.
title: Africa: Global Education Must Integrate AI, Centred On Humanity

description: [MAP] Rabat -- Portugal's Secretary of State for the Economy, João Rui Ferreira, underlined, on Thursday in Rabat, Morocco's role as a gateway for Portuguese operators in Africa.
title: Africa: Portuguese Top Official Hails Morocco's Role As 'Gateway to Africa' for Portuguese Operators

description: [WFP] Energy projects are fighting hunger - and much more
title: Africa: Communities Power Up Their Food Security Across Africa

description: [The Conversation Africa] African Perspectives on Agroecology is a new book with 33 contributions from academics, non-governmental organisations, farmer organisations and policy makers. It is free to download, and reviewers have described it as a "must read for all who care about the future of Africa and its people". The book outlines how agroecology, which brings ecological principles into farming practices and food systems, can solve food shortages and environmental damage caused by mass, commercial farming. We asked the book's
title: Africa: Industrial Scale Farming Is Flawed - What Ecologically-Friendly Farming Practices Could Look Like in Africa

description: [IPS] New York -- The International Day of Education, January 24, reminds us of the power of education to transform children's lives, and to build vibrant, sustainable societies.
title: Africa: A New Chance to Expand Children's Access to Education
